messages.content: 9-1-1, what's your emergency?
Hello, this is 9-1-1, right?
Yes, how can I help you?
I need help quickly down at 1385 River Road, Greedyville, South Carolina.
Okay, what's going on there?
A guy tried to kill me, and I had to take my gun back from him. I'm bleeding now.
Can you tell me where you are exactly?
1385 River Road. It comes off Burgess, where River Road turns into a dirt road.
Got it. What's your name?
My name is Paul Baker.
Mr. Baker, what's your phone number?
I don't know my phone number. I’m calling from a cell phone.
Okay, and can you tell me what happened again?
A man beat me and took my gun. He wanted to kill me. He's the one who took my truck too.
What kind of truck is it?
It's a 78 model Chevy green truck.
Who is this man? Do you know his name?
I don't know his name. I know him from a bar, but he beat me and took my gun.
Where are you bleeding from?
From my head. I'm bleeding a lot.
Do you need medical attention?
Yes, I'm going back into the house. I don't want trouble, but please send someone quickly.
We're sending someone to you. Stay inside and stay safe.
Thank you.
Do you need an ambulance?
Yes, please. The guy came back and I shot him.
You shot him? Where is he now?
He's on the ground, in front of my trailer.
What does your house look like?
It's a trailer with a long driveway lined with trees.
Okay, we're sending EMS and police. Is he still conscious?
No, I don't think so. I shot him several times.
What part of his body did you shoot?
In the chest. I used to be a paramedic. He's gone.
We have help on the way, sir.
Please hurry.
Stay on the line with me. We're almost there.
Okay, but my phone connection is not great. I may lose you.
We understand. If you get disconnected and they arrive, stay safe and make sure they know you are unarmed.
